item.title: Git Notes
item.description: Git Notes Data in Git is like a set of snapshots of a mini filesystem, every commit is a snapshot of all the files at the moment, with reference stored for that snapsthot; Files that have not changed aren’t stored - instead just a link to the previous identical file that has been stored already. nearly every operation is local everything is check-summed (SHA-1) to ensure integrity most operations only add data to Git database Three States Git has three main states for files:
